concept_data.title: interinstitutional relations (EU)
concept_data.category_name: EU institutions and European civil service
concept_data.category_full: 1006 EU institutions and European civil service

summary: Interinstitutional relations within the European Union (EU) refer to the structured interactions and collaborations among the EU's key institutions, including the European Commission, European Parliament, and the Council of the European Union. These relations are governed by various legal frameworks and regulatory practices that aim to ensure coherence and efficiency in policy-making and legislative processes. Effective interinstitutional relations are crucial for the functioning of the EU's governance system, facilitating negotiation, consensus-building, and the implementation of EU law. This concept underscores the importance of cooperation and dialogue in achieving the Union's objectives and enhancing democratic legitimacy.
